def_en: If you say that someone or something is all right, you mean that you find them satisfactory or acceptable.
If you say that something happens or goes all right, you mean that it happens in a satisfactory or acceptable manner.

def_cn: 安全健康（的）；平安无恙（的）
def_en: If someone or something is all right, they are well or safe.
If you say that something is true all right or something will happen all right, you are emphasizing that there is no doubt that it is true or that it will happen.
You say 'all right' when you are agreeing to something.

You say 'all right?' after you have given an instruction or explanation to someone when you are checking that they have understood what you have just said, or checking that they agree with or accept what you have just said.

def_cn: 就这样吧，那么（表示想结束一项活动，开始另一活动）
def_en: If someone in a position of authority says 'all right', and suggests talking about or doing something else, they are indicating that they want you to end one activity and start another.

def_cn: 好吧（在讨论中用以表示理解对方的话并引入相关的话）
def_en: You say 'all right' during a discussion to show that you understand something that someone has just said, and to introduce a statement that relates to it.

def_cn: 唉，喂（表示责难或威胁某人）
def_en: You say all right before a statement or question to indicate that you are challenging or threatening someone.
